newsitem.title: USA: GTE gets $60 mln Saudi ARAMCO contracts.
newsitem.headline: GTE gets $60 mln Saudi ARAMCO contracts.

text.p: GTE said Thursday it had won two contracts worth more than $60 million from Saudi ARAMCO to provide a communications system for Saudi Arabia's Shaybah oil field.
The company said the systems, to be completed in 1998, is to help the country increase its oil production operations.
GTE Telecom Saudi Arabia is to take charge of the contracts with Dubaib & Sulaim Co as its partner, it said.

The company said the first contract is for site construction and installation of telecommunications equipment, while the second one is for the engineering and design of the system as well as procurement of materials and equipment.
